synopsis.text: Japanese soldier and aspiring mangaka, Tamaru, finds himself stationed on the idyllic Peleliu Island during the height of World War II. As the Battle of Peleliu unfolds, Tamaru and his fellow soldiers face a grueling and high-casualty campaign that lasts for months. Despite the harsh realities of war, Tamaru clings to his dreams of returning home to create manga inspired by the island's wild beauty. However, as the battle rages on, Tamaru and his comrades are forced to confront the possibility that they may never leave Peleliu alive. This anime adaptation of Kazuyoshi Takeda's Peleliu: Rakuen no Guernica manga offers a poignant and harrowing look at the daily lives of soldiers during one of history's deadliest conflicts.
synopsis.author: mistral.mistral-large-2402-v1:0
